title: Integrate system dark/light mode with theme switcher
description:
## Context
Linux has a system-wide dark/light mode preference via `org.freedesktop.appearance` (xdg-desktop-portal). Apps like Firefox and Claude Desktop respect this setting.

## Goal
Extend `dots theme` to automatically set the system color-scheme when switching themes, so all apps respect the dark/light preference.

## Implementation
1. Ensure xdg-desktop-portal-gtk or xdg-desktop-portal-gnome is installed
2. Modify theme switcher to run:
   - `gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.interface color-scheme 'prefer-dark'` for dark themes
   - `gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.interface color-scheme 'prefer-light'` for light themes
3. Theme metadata needs to indicate whether it's dark or light (may already exist in Black Atom theme definitions)

## Verification
```bash
gdbus call --session \
  --dest=org.freedesktop.portal.Desktop \
  --object-path=/org/freedesktop/portal/desktop \
  --method=org.freedesktop.portal.Settings.Read \
  org.freedesktop.appearance color-scheme
```
Should return 1 for dark, 2 for light.

title: Add repos sync command for multi-machine workflow
description:
## Problem

When working across multiple machines (e.g., Linux at home, Mac at work), it's easy to forget to push all changes before leaving. This leads to out-of-sync repos and lost work context.

## Solution Implemented

Added two new commands to `repos`:

### `repos leave` - End of day workflow
Interactive walkthrough of dirty repos with menu:
1. Review in LazyGit
2. Commit with AI (`repo sc`)
3. Save as WIP (auto-commit with timestamp)
4. Cleanup with Claude (multi-commit semantic cleanup)
5. Push without committing
6. Skip this repo
7. Stop walkthrough

After walkthrough, offers to batch push all repos with unpushed commits.

### `repos arrive` - Start of day workflow
```bash
repos arrive      # Parallel pull all repos
repos arrive -i   # Interactive mode for conflict handling
```

Pulls all repos, reports: updated / conflicts / up-to-date / skipped.

## Files Changed
- `common/.local/bin/repos` - Added leave/arrive commands and helper functions
